column4: I have already put the necessary firmware in lib/firmware
no I havent check dmesg yet
if you ever have driver issues, always check dmesg first
drivers (usually) put (usually) more descriptive messages in dmesg
if firmware cannot load, that is where the error will be found.
last 30 errors, do it right after load fails
this is what Im getting http://pastie.org/1584322
do: rmmod ar9170 ar9170usb ; modprobe ar1970usb ; dmesg | tail -n 30
rtl8192 driver is very noisy and constantly pushes stuff to dmesg
I have the 8191, uses the same driver, it's annoying
i think im gonna recompile compat first and see if that fixes it, real quick
this is what I got http://pastie.org/1584344
